intro: Cordula siamensis, commonly known as the Siam cordula, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
